links.title: Frequency mixer - Wikipedia
links.description: In electronics, a mixer, or frequency mixer, is a nonlinear electrical circuit that creates new frequencies from two signals applied to it. In its most common application, two signals are applied to a mixer, and it produces new signals at the sum and difference of the original frequencies.  Other frequency components may also be produced in a practical frequency mixer.

links.title: Auditory scene analysis - Wikipedia
links.description: In perception and psychophysics, auditory scene analysis (ASA) is a proposed model for the basis of auditory perception. This is understood as the process by which the human auditory system organizes sound into perceptually meaningful elements. The term was coined by psychologist Albert Bregman.[1]  The related concept in machine perception is computational auditory scene analysis (CASA), which is closely related to source separation and blind si...

links.title: Maintaining the kernel's web of trust
links.description:
A typical kernel development cycle involves pulling patches from over 100
repositories into the mainline.  Any of those pulls could conceivably
bring with it malicious code, leaving the kernel (and its users) open to
compromise.  The kernel's web of trust helps maintainers to ensure that
pull requests are legitimate, but that web has become difficult to maintain
in the wake of the recent attacks on key
servers and other problems.  So now the kern...

links.description: Elm is a text-based email client commonly found on Unix systems. First released in 1986, it became popular as one of the first email clients to use a text user interface, and as a utility with freely available source code. The name elm originated from the phrase ELectronic Mail.[1]

links.title: An important quantum algorithm may actually be a property of nature
links.description: Evidence that quantum searches are an ordinary feature of electron behavior may explain the genetic code, one of the greatest puzzles in biology.
links.original_title: An important quantum algorithm may be a property of nature

links.title: About Us
links.description: The mission of MIT Technology Review is to bring about better-informed and more conscious decisions about technology through authoritative, influential, and trustworthy journalism.

links.title: The Grover search as a naturally occurring phenomenon
links.description:
We provide the first evidence that under certain conditions, electrons may
naturally behave like a Grover search, looking for defects in a material. The
theoretical framework is that of discrete-time quantum walks (QW), i.e. local
unitary matrices that drive the evolution of a single particle on the lattice.
Some of these are well-known to recover the $(2+1)$--dimensional Dirac equation
in continuum limit, i.e. the free propagation of the electro...

links.title: Natural nuclear fission reactor - Wikipedia
links.description: A fossil natural nuclear fission reactor is a uranium deposit where self-sustaining nuclear chain reactions have occurred. This can be examined by analysis of isotope ratios. The conditions under which a natural nuclear reactor could exist had been predicted in 1956 by Paul Kazuo Kuroda.[1]  The phenomenon was discovered in 1972 in Oklo, Gabon by French physicist Francis Perrin under conditions very similar to what was predicted.
